result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CASH BOND SET - $50.00 PER CASE
- Defendant shall not be on N Town Rd in Windsor or Deforest.
  Trial Judge - Br 17

Court reporter Paige Reardon. Defendant Colton S Reindahl in court, in custody.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. In court for a bail bond hearing for return on warrant. Court has discussion with defendant regarding appointment of counsel. State recommends additional $500 bail in total. Mr. Reindahl gives statement and answers questions of the court. Court imposes $50 cash bond on each of the 6 cases (22CF1858, 22CF64, 22CF408, 22CM287, 22CM288, 22CM674). ALL OTHER BAIL CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.

11:25 AM Defendant did not appear.  Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE did not appear. Court to issue a body only bench warrant  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not be on N Town Rd in Windsor or Deforest.
  Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.
  Trial Judge - Br 17

10:19 AM Defendant appeared.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant DID NOT receive a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. WARRANT VACATED. COURT TO MAIL COPY OF COMPLAINT TO DEFENDANT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 11:15 am.
